p: It was verified by [ 19], on the control of the phytopathogen Colletotrichum graminicola, that the lemongrass essential oil stood out as the most fungitoxic, since that occurred inhibition of 100% of fungus mycelial growth from the concentration (0.50 μL mL −1). The fact that the C. citratus essential oil was not efficient on the in vitro inhibition test, but effective on the conidia germination and preventive control, demonstrates that it is very important to realize essays in vivo, but is also necessary in future works, in order to enlighten the mechanism of action of essential oils upon the plant diseases.
